content.description: Left of mammoth cave. Cracks and horizontal seams distinguish this route.
content.location: Furthest right on the main wall, just left of large cave.

content.description: Tricky climbing. Straight up pockets then cut left into large hueco after third bolt. Watch out for active bees and wasp nests. Pockets often fill with Daddy Long Leg spiders, so clean those out before attempting.
content.location: Climb through the only features of the otherwise steep, blank, face.

content.description:
This is another project that's not listed in The Belton Project Guidebook.

 Climb the line of bolts on the right of the large roof.
content.location: Far right side arete feature of the massive roof.

content.description: Line of tan colored bolts going out the center of the massive roof up into the obvious drilled undercling in the middle of the face. Looks impossible.
content.location: Center of the large roof. I think this is the project based on how hard it looks...this might be something that was never listed in The Belton Project guidebook though. I'm not really sure.

content.description: Up the pockets left of the next huge roof and right of the obvious knobby crack.
content.location: Left of the large roof and a few feet left of the crack.

content.description: Traverse left out crack to face
content.location: Leftmost bolted route at the main section on Front Wall.Left of the large cave near the top of the cliff which separates the other routes on the main wall.
On the far right side of the wall, around the corner from the massive roof with the two projects.

content.description:
Significantly easier than all the rest but still quite hard.

Rebolted as of April 2021.
content.location: Guidebook says "right of the huge cave", and I think that might mean the big cave at the top of the cliff, right of the knobby crack, but not right of the massive roof, because the only line there looks waaay harder than 5.10.Either way, this line is about 5.10 so it fits.

content.description: Start on the ground and climb into Desert Shield. Watch out for the boulder.
content.location: Same line as Desert Shield but start lower.

content.description: Start on boulder. Climb drilled pockets up the steep face. An OG testpiece that needs rebolting.
content.location: Climbs the steepest, blankest, section of the main face.

content.description:
Start on Anarchy graffiti. Out steep grey wall. 

 The ground may have eroded away significantly over the past 25 years, as the obvious drilled jug just above all the graffiti is a good 9 feet off the ground. That with the combination of horrible start holds and no feet means the hardest move of the route is getting to this starting jug. This can be skipped by starting on the boulder, using a decently sized cheat stack, or having a 3 foot vertical. 

 If you wanna get the old school points, accept the difficulty of bouldering the opening move, if you just wanna climb the route, I'd recommending starting on the boulder, but you do you.
content.location: Right side of the main face, slightly less steep than the lines to the left with obvious drilled pockets up the whole climb.

content.description: I think this is the obvious crack to the right of Primadonna, and I think it's a trad line since the only bolts I saw are the ones for Primadonna.
content.location: Knobby Crack. Just left of the large roof.

content.description: Start off boulder with undercling mono. Jump to the hueco. Ascend obvious features up and left, then divine a path to the anchors.
content.location: Just right of the large cave near the top of the cliff. Distinguished by the large circular hueco about 20 feet up the wall.

content.description: Hard start leads into tons of orange honeycomb features. Climb up and right to rest, then out roof. This is the "warm up".

The Front Wall does not offer much easier climbing than Wrath Wall, and the rock quality here is not quite as good as what can be found at Wrath. Nevertheless, there are several good routes in the 5.12 and 5.13 range including some fun "warm ups". Be careful to inspect the bolts before any climbing here. Many of the bolts and hangars are old, rusted, and need replacement.
